<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 790, 90]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of \(\tanh\) and \(\operatorname {sech}\) in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 101, 578, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\tanh^2 t + \operatorname {sech}^2 t = 1. \quad (3)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 381, 141, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 450, 399]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[295, 411, 702, 431]]<|/det|>
\[x = \ln (\cosh t),\quad y = \tan^{-1}(\sinh t),\quad \mathrm{for} \ 0\leqslant t\leqslant 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 443, 320, 460]]<|/det|>
Find the length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 443, 920, 460]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 82, 146, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 75, 460, 109]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^2y}{\mathrm{dx}^2}\) at the point \((4, \frac{1}{3})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 82, 920, 102]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 113, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 544, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 108, 608, 141]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}x}{\mathrm{d}t^{2}} +\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} -2x = 2t^{2} + t - 1,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 160, 400, 185]]<|/det|>
given that, when \(t = 0\) , \(x = \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} = 0\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[880, 161, 920, 180]]<|/det|>
<mark>[10]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 203, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 70, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 71, 457, 88]]<|/det|>
Use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[368, 109, 633, 144]]<|/det|>
\[\sec 5\theta = \frac{\sec^5\theta}{5\sec^4\theta - 20\sec^2\theta + 16}. \quad [6]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[920, 119, 945, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 148, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 460, 88]]<|/det|>
Hence, obtain the roots of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 101, 613, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\sqrt{3} x^{5} - 10x^{4} + 40x^{2} - 32 = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 134, 470, 151]]<|/det|>
in the form \(\sec(q\pi)\), where \(q\) is rational.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 134, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 163, 917, 935]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 85, 845, 597]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 609, 920, 658]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{1}{x^2 + 1}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n\) rectangles of width \(\frac{1}{n}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 666, 146, 685]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 666, 672, 685]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[426, 701, 571, 743]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}\frac{n}{n^{2} + r^{2}} < \frac{1}{4}\pi .\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 711, 920, 730]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 745, 917, 935]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 70, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 70, 465, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 108, 591, 142]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} -\frac{2x + 6}{x^2 + 6x + 5} y = 4,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 163, 630, 182]]<|/det|>
given that \(y = 0\) when \(x = 0\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 163, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[9]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 193, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 581, 90]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 96, 567, 117]]<|/det|>
\[{\frac{3}{2}}x+3y+8z=1,\] \[ax+3y+4z=2,\] \[ay-z=3,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 408, 182]]<|/det|>
does not have a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 164, 918, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 195, 917, 432]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 443, 316, 460]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 466, 571, 526]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{3}{2} & 3 & 8 \\ 0 & 3 & 4 \\ 0 & 0 & -1 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 536, 146, 555]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 918, 570]]<|/det|>
Given that \(\mathbf{B} = \mathbf{A}^{-1}\) , use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that \(\mathbf{B}^2 = p\mathbf{I} + q\mathbf{A}\) , where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 553, 918, 571]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 583, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 144, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 670, 95]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^{-1} = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 95]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 103, 917, 945]]<|/det|>
